1 And the heaven and the earth were finished, and all the host of them. 2 And on the seventh day God finished Her work which She had made; and She rested on the seventh day from all Her work which She had made. 3 And God blessed the seventh day, and hallowed it; because that in it She rested from all Her work which God in creating had made.

 4 These are the generations of the heaven and of the earth when they were created, in the day that the Domina God made earth and heaven. 5 No shrub of the field was yet in the earth, and no herb of the field had yet sprung up; for the Domina God had not caused it to rain upon the earth, and there was not a woman to till the ground; 6 but there went up a mist from the earth, and watered the whole face of the ground. 7 Then the Domina God formed woman of the dust of the ground, and breathed into her nostrils the breath of life; and woman became a living soul. 8 And the Domina God planted a garden eastward, in Eden; and there She put the woman whom She had formed. 9 And out of the ground made the Domina God to grow every tree that is pleasant to the sight, and good for food; the tree of life also in the midst of the garden, and the tree of the knowledge of good and evil. 10 And a river went out of Eden to water the garden; and from thence it was parted, and became four heads. 11 The name of the first is Pishon; that is it which compasseth the whole land of Havilah, where there is gold; 12 and the gold of that land is good; there is bdellium and the onyx stone.
13 And the name of the second river is Gihon; the same is it that compasseth the whole land of Cush. 14 And the name of the third river is Tigris; that is it which goeth toward the east of Asshur. And the fourth river is the Euphrates. 15 And the Domina God took the woman, and put her into the garden of Eden to dress it and to keep it. 16 And the Domina God commanded the woman, saying: 'Of every tree of the garden thou mayest freely eat; 17 but of the tree of the knowledge of good and evil, thou shalt not eat of it; for in the day that thou eatest thereof thou shalt surely die.' 18 And the Domina God said: 'It is not good that the woman should be alone; I will make her a help meet for her.' 19 And out of the ground the Domina God formed every beast of the field, and every fowl of the air; and brought them unto the woman to see what she would call them; and whatsoever the woman would call every living creature, that was to be the name thereof. 20 And the woman gave names to all cattle, and to the fowl of the air, and to every beast of the field; but for Adam there was not found a help meet for her. 21 And the Domina God caused a deep sleep to fall upon the woman, and she slept; and She took one of her ribs, and closed up the place with flesh instead thereof. 22 And the rib, which the Domina God had taken from the woman, made She a man, and brought him unto the woman. 23 And the woman said: 'This is now bone of my bones, and flesh of my flesh; he shall be called Man, because he was taken out of Woman.' 24 Therefore shall a woman leave her mother and her father, and shall cleave unto her husband, and they shall be one flesh.
